NEIGH Name: South of the Borough
AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

description: Variation of Condition 2 (Approved Plans) of Planning Permission ref: 17/10501/HOU (Erection of single storey side/ front extension including front porch) dated 16/02/2018. Variation to include chages to separation of front and side extensions, width reduction to side extension and addition of side path, volume reduction to front extension, changes to fenestration and removal of chimney to rear.
decision_conditions: Development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission (ref. 17/10501/HOU). Reason:  As required  by Section 91 of  the Town  and Country Planning  Act  1990,  as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Information in the form of plans and further written details need to be submitted to show:-1)	How contractor parking arrangements are to be provided, as on-site parking will not be allowed;2)	A swept path (tracking) drawing has been provided to show how vehicles will safely enter and egress from the site;3)	Details of strategic access (haul routes);4)	A strengthened vehicle crossover for construction vehicles to prevent damage to the public highway; and,5)	A commitment to arranging with RBK Highways for a vehicle crossover to be installed at the applicant's own expense;

The submitted floor plans do not have a North point.Please provide existing and proposed floor plans at a recognised scale (at 1:50 or 1:100 for example), showing the outline of entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions for the proposed works. The plans must also show the direction of North. Although the inclusion of a scale bar is not mandatory, it is encouraged.
